page.title: 17FASHION
page.content: One of our slides shows various types of clothes worn by children in 1985. A scout or cub wears a shirt/jumper, trousers,neckerchief and berry or cap. A girl Guide wears a blue shirt and skirt, neckerchief and hat.The young Brownie wears a brown dress,belt and hat and yellow tie. Much sports wear, shorts and vests or leotards are made of man-made fibres. For outdoors T-shirt,denim jeans, wellington boots and nylon cagool or cotton dungarees and T-shirt. School wear may be cotton shirt,tie, grey trousers and blazer or sweat shirt T-shirt and trousers.For girls cotton skirt,half mesh top and cardigan.At night boys wear pyjamas and girls a nightgown. At the youth club a girl may wear a mini-dress and leather tie, while the boy wears shirt,tie and trousers.
